TextView.android:text: In the present work, we have extended our efforts by developing a mobile application alongside the existing web application to enhance accessibility for users. Additionally, we created a clickbait analyzer where users can input a statement or headline to assess the likelihood of it being fraudulent, thereby incorporating a fact-checking mechanism. The mobile application and web platform both address the issue of fraudulent applications in the digital marketplace. They utilize machine learning models implemented in Python for sentiment analysis and fraud detection. The mobile application complements the web version, which integrates a database to fetch and analyze user app reviews. For the web application, Django serves as the web framework, MongoDB is utilized for efficient storage and retrieval of app review data, and Python powers the machine learning analysis. The clickbait analyzer uses similar technologies to provide users with reliable tools for assessing credibility. Both platforms prioritize user-friendliness, with interfaces designed using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks suited for mobile and web environments....
